page.title: 10Customs and Superstitions
page.content: The{breaking}of a mirror heralds {seven years}of{bad luck.}A{pair}of {knives}on a{table}which have their {blades crossed}are the{sign}of a {quarrel.}It is{regarded}as{unlucky}for {two people}to{pass}on the{stairs.}The {opening}of an{umbrella indoors}is {looked}on as a{gesture}which will bring{bad look}to the{household.}It is also{considered unlucky}to take {hawthorn blossom indoors.Spiders}found in the house are{carefully placed {outside}except for the{tiny ones,}or {money spiders,}and{these}have the{free {run}of the house.The{holding}of a {buttercup}under a{persons chin}to{test if they{like butter,}a{yellow {reflection signifies}if they{do."Don't {cast a clout until May is out",}is a timely{reminder}that there can be{cold days in{May,}and{winter clothing}might still be{welcome.
